name: Coeur des Alpes

reviews.text: After reading so many lovely reviews about the Coeur des Alpes, we had to experience it for ourselves! Being the off season, we managed to get some good room rates and decided to spend three nights in Zermatt. The hotel could offer us one night in a big double room before moving to a suite (facing the Matterhorn) for the next two nights.
reviews.title: Splurge on a suite!

likes.liked: — breakfast was great, suite was a nice splurge

reviews.text: We arrived in Zermatt and decided to walk to the hotel rather than calling for a pick-up. Unfortunately this meant that we surprised the receptionist a bit but she was gracious and quickly made us feel at home. Our check in to the double room was easy.
reviews.title: Extraordinary!

reviews.text: The room itself was nice although not spectacular, in my opinion. It felt on the ordinary side and I began to wonder what the big fuss was about this hotel. I have no complaints about this room as everything was clean and the view was pleasant (over the village of Zermatt).
reviews.title: Great hotel in a fantastic resort.

likes.disliked: — We only stayed there for three nights...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next morning we enjoyed a hearty breakfast. In fact, this was probably the best breakfast of our trip. The staff was friendly and the food was very good.
reviews.title: Wonderfull hotel..Wonderful Views

likes.disliked: — Room size...but who cares...you're in Zermatt get outside!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a few hours of exploring, we returned to the hotel to check into our suite. Wow!! The suite was amazing! This is the reason to stay at the Coeur des Alpes!! Our suite had wonderful views and plenty of space. There was a Bose stereo that provided soothing music while I treated myself to a bath in the huge tub. We had snow one day and we felt so fortunate to be warm and cozy in our room while we opened all the curtains and watched the snow fall. I'm sure that the views are absolutely stunning in the winter when there is lots of snow on the ground.
reviews.title: Just a Wonderful Experience

likes.liked: — Friendliness of all, family approach to their operations, rooms, relaxing environment, unique

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from this hotel. Unfortunately we booked it very late and we had the opportunity to stay one night only. However the hotel is really wonderful. Everything looks great with a mix of wood, iron and glass and really good taste in the furniture. You are welcome by flowers smell and by warm people, offering you a glass of prosecco while checking in. You immediately feel like at home.The breakfast room and the lobby is great: a glass floor give you a view on the circle pool, a large window and the balcony a great view on the matterhorn. The Sauna and the Swimming Pool are a plus where you can relax after a day hiking. It is just at the end of the town in a good position: it's very quite but you can walk in 5 minutes to the center of the town.
reviews.title: We'll be here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having discovered that the Coeur des Alpes was reviewed number 1 from nearly 100 hotels in Zermatt on TripAdvisor, I decided it was worth checking out for myself.
reviews.title: Living Up to a Reputation

likes.liked: — The service and views... OK everything!

reviews.text: My wife and I travelled to Zermatt for a wedding anniversary weekend and booked two nights in the Penthouse Suite (401) as a treat. We were not let down.
reviews.title: Best hotel in the world

reviews.text: We prefer to stay in places where we don't get overcrowded by the owners, enjoying the personal touch, but we don't want to feel obliged to sit with them for hours chatting over coffee. The Coeur des Alpes was very satisfying in this regard. The staff were very efficient and friendly, calling us by name (even using familiar rather than formal terms in German, which I liked), and offering good advices on activities etc. Every service that you might expect was provided personally, such as cooking eggs for breakfast and recommending restaurants. Overall, the service was exceptional, though not ridiculously over the top, and very satisfactory... with the exception of one small porter incident.
reviews.title: A Stunner!

reviews.text: Then there is the hotel itself, the building, the views, and the amenities. All of these are of high standard. The building is very artistic and even though I tend to prefer more traditional properties (Swiss style), the balance of modern art fittings and antique furniture was very well applied. The wellness centre is very nice and drinks and fresh melon was laid on for guests too.
reviews.title: Despite the construction this was an experience not to miss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 6 nights in penthouse 401 and 1 night in new loft Leni 12-19 april 2009.
reviews.title: Truly the Heart of the Alps!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Previous years we stayed at the Omnia (see review) which is a remarkable hotel in Zermatt. Although after reading about the outstanding reviews given to Coeur des Alpes, we decided to give it a try! A little more than one week has now passed since departing Zermatt and Coeur des Alpes, which truly stands for its name: Heart of the Alps! And it was with true grief in our Hearts we hade to leave! Yes, it is absolutely a warm and openhearted hospitality greeting you from the moment you step into the hotel. You feel like a part of the Leni & Thomas family and their remarkable team. The hotel in itself is a pearl. The furniture, the style, the décor and all the details join into a tastefully tranquil and beautiful design. Our penthouse suite had breathtaking views of Matterhorn and the ski slopes from basically every corner of the large room. Everything was just perfect and the interior design exquisite. All amenities needed with CD and DVD player and a fireplace. We enjoyed several afternoons in the warm sun on our large terrace, being completed hypnotized by the view. Is it possible to be more relaxed? Well, then you can always go down to the hotel’s marvellous spa/haman offering you almost complete repose and recovery. Sit down in the outdoor jacuzzi and ask Leni or someone else to bring you a cold drink. Get the pleasure from the fantastic view. The breakfast served is excellent, and which hotel will call their guests who overslept breakfast hours offering to bring some to your room, or whenever at your convenience downstairs in the breakfast room? Because we re-scheduled our arrival/departure day we had to change room for our final night. We were not let down. The new lofts are probably one of the most striking rooms I have seen! They do not have the same fantastic view but it is more than compensated in its comfort and design. Another good aspect of the hotel is its location: 150 meters away from the main ski lift and 400 meters to the centre. I miss a restaurant in the hotel but hopefully the owners are considering this for the future. Although, this will not prevent me from returning to my Heart in the Alps!
reviews.title: trully #1

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I had a wonderful stay at this hotel on the last night of our honeymoon trip, which made the whole trip excellent. The staffs were very friendly. We stayed at the loft which was new & nice. The facilities offered were excellent, with outdoor jacuzzi overlooking the tip of the Matterhorn. The only downside is that the hotel is almost always fully booked so be sure to book in advance, probably 2 years ahead.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Switzerland!

likes.liked: — The lovely book we got as a parting gift describing the hotel and its owners.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved this hotel! The furniture and decor was lovely; very modern. The pool area was fantastic. There was a sauna and a steam room. I felt like I was at a spa. All I needed was the massage. We stayed in a Double room. The room was a little small. The room was very clean and had that modern minimalistic look. Very bright and clean. Very quiet. I didn't hear any noise. The hotel is just beautiful. You have to see it!
reviews.title: Excellent stay, superb staff

likes.disliked: — rough finish of some designed areas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a week at Coeur des Alpes. It was just fantastic. Having planned this trip as a second honeymoon we booked a loft which was suggested to us by super friendly staff member Nicole when we called the hotel. The loft itself was of a good size and the furniture was modern. The interior design is by the owner's brother, Heinz Julen. Although we liked most of the design features, some things such as the chandeliers and the rough finish were rather strange. But hey, I guess it's art and you either like it or not. The staff and the owners were very friendly and we never had the feeling that the hospitaly extended to us was superficial - it came from their heart. The breakfast buffet was very good with most of the items freshly prepared. We also had a great time with other guests at the weekly raclette dinner. The only let down was a mix up with our loft but this little problem was solved calmly and very professionally, like all other services and extras which we requested. We shall certainly be back - the Zermatt / Coeur des Alpes virus has certainly infected us.
reviews.title: We loved this hotel!

likes.liked: — Beautiful views from our rooms and excellent service from staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for our honeymoon and I can honestly say it was the most fantastic hotel I have stayed in. My Husband and I have both stayed in a number of hotels and this by far exceeds anything we have stayed in before.
reviews.title: Fantastic and magical hotel.

reviews.text: We had a suite and woke up every morning to the view of the Matterhorn. The staff are superb and nothing is to much for them. The spa is absolutely fantastic as well. It is a five minute walk from the train staion to the hotel and if you follow the river it is a very flat walk. I found the location superb. We loved it that much we have already booked to go back next year. If you want to go you have to be quick as in the winter season they get booked up very quickly.
reviews.title: Great for skiing - location is now even better thanks to...

reviews.text: I chose the Coeur des Alpes as it was rated #1 on tripadvisor. First, don't be fooled by reviews talking about the distance from the railway station: getting to the hotel from the town main street (where the railway station is) it's a 5 minute walk, so don't worry. It's also quieter than some hotels near some pubs
reviews.title: So romantic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Then don't just focus on the.. "romancing" side: this is one of the best location on Zermatt for skiers. It's probably among the 10 properties nearer to the Matterhorn Express Gondola-Lift, were you can leave your skis in the evening so you don't have to bring them back to the hotel.
reviews.title: I love Coeur des Alpes

likes.liked: — Me gusta todo / I love everything

reviews.title: Crème de la crème
reviews.text: Owners and employees were extremely firendly, and helped me plan a perfect "late April escape" from Rome. They were EXTREMELY helpful.

description: We are a little unique hotel in Zermatt with a wonderful view to the Matterhorn. The artist Heinz Julen our brother made a fantastic boutique hotel for us. We love to make you happy.
